dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes
Class CTypeDescriptors

java.lang.Object
  dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.CDSGenScope.Attribute
      dreisoft.tresos.generator.ng.api.cds.ctypes.CTypeDescriptors

public class CTypeDescriptors
extends CDSGenScope.Attribute

This CDSGenScope.Attribute keeps information of the allocated size in byte and the preferred alignment of CTypes. After creating a CTypeDescriptors instance it contains default values for all concrete built-in types. It is possible to change these values and to define new values for own CType classes by passing an appropriate list of CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor instances to the constructor. The values of this class are immutable. So once a CTypeDescriptors object is created it is neither possible to change the values nor to extends the list of CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor anymore.

sizeof

This class provides functionality to calculate the size in bytes that is allocated by the given CType.

Alignment

If a scope contains this attribute then the CDS backend should align the generated CTypes at the specified position. The alignment is meant to be the position in memory at which a generated CType starts. The default value is 1, so every type starts at the next free memory position and actually there is no special alignment. To achieve a different alignment than 1 it is potentially necessary for the CDS generator to add padding bytes between the last generated type and the new type until the next free memory position is a multiple of the specified alignment value.

Copyright (C) Elektrobit Automotive GmbH - All rights reserved

Since:
2008.b

Constructor Detail

CTypeDescriptors

public CTypeDescriptors()
Creates a new CTypeDescriptors scope attribute and initializes the values for all concrete built-in CTypes.

Since:
2008.b

CTypeDescriptors

public CTypeDescriptors(CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor[] descriptors)
Creates a new CTypeDescriptors scope attribute with initial values for all concrete built-in CTypes and the values from the given descriptor array. If the given array contains values for built-in types then these values overwrite the default values. Any attempt to set an invalid value for a built-in type will cause an IllegalArgumentException.

Default type descriptors:

Type Alignment Size
UInt8 1 1
SInt8 1 1
UInt16 2 2
SInt16 2 2
UInt32 4 4
SInt32 4 4
Ptr 4 4
Struct 1 n/a (struct has no fix size)
Array 1 n/a (array has no fix size)
PBPtr 2 2

Parameters:
descriptors - A list of CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor that can contain descriptors for built-in classes and own CType classes, my be null
Since:
2008.b

CTypeDescriptors

public CTypeDescriptors(CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor[] descriptors,
                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> thresholdListStructs,
                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> alignListStructs,
                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> thresholdListArrays,
                        java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> alignListArrays)
Creates a new CTypeDescriptors scope attribute with initial values for all concrete built-in CTypes and the values from the given descriptor array. If the given array contains values for built-in types then these values overwrite the default values. Any attempt to set an invalid value for a built-in type will cause an IllegalArgumentException. For arrays and structures, size dependent alignment requirements must be provided.

Default type descriptors:

Type Alignment Size
UInt8 1 1
SInt8 1 1
UInt16 2 2
SInt16 2 2
UInt32 4 4
SInt32 4 4
Ptr 4 4
Struct 1 n/a (struct has no fix size)
Array 1 n/a (array has no fix size)
PBPtr 2 2

Parameters:
descriptors - A list of CTypeDescriptors.CTypeDescriptor that can contain descriptors for built-in classes and own CType classes, my be null
thresholdListStructs - list of integral values defining the maximum structure size for which a given alignment must be applied
alignListStructs - list of integral values defining the minimal size dependent alignment for structures. The nth element in this list corresponds to the nth element in thresholdListStructs. alignListStructs must contain one additional element at the end which defines the alignment if the structure is larger than any entry in thresholdListStructs.
thresholdListArrays - list of integral values defining the maximum array size for which a given alignment must be applied
alignListArrays - list of integral values defining the minimal size dependent alignment for arrays. The nth element in this list corresponds to the nth element in thresholdListArrays. alignListArrays must contain one additional element at the end which defines the alignment if the array is larger than any entry in thresholdListArrays.
Since:
15.0
Method Detail

getAlignment

public int getAlignment(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> typeClass)
                 throws CDSGenAPIException
Returns the alignment associated with the given CType class. The given class must not be be a subclass of Struct or Array. If there is no special alignment set for the given class then it inherits the alignment from a superclass. Every concrete built-in CType class has an alignment per default so it must be found in a valid class hierarchy.

To get the alignment of a class derived from Struct or Array use getAlignment(CType).

Returns:
The alignment to be used for the given CType class.
Throws:
CDSGenAPIException - if the given class is not supported by this method

sizeof

public int sizeof(java.lang.Class<? extends CType> typeClass)
           throws CDSGenAPIException
Returns the size of the given CType class. The given class can only be a subclass of PrimitiveType or Ptr. If there is no special size set for the given class then it inherits the size from a superclass. Every concrete built-in primitive or pointer class has an size per default so it must be found in a valid class hierarchy.

To get the size of Struct or Array types use sizeof(CType).

Parameters:
typeClass - A CType class. Must be subclass of PrimitiveType or Ptr.
Returns:
The size in bytes that is allocated by the given CType class.
Throws:
CDSGenAPIException - if the given class is not supported by this method
Since:
2008.b

sizeof

public int sizeof(CType ctype)
Calculates the size of the given CType object.

If the given ctype is a Struct or Array then it must be fully initialized to evaluate the member resp. elements correctly. If a Struct implementing the IConditionalMembers interface is given then this method considers only those members that exist according to the result of method IConditionalMembers.exists(String).

Parameters:
ctype - A CType object.
Returns:
The size in bytes that is allocated by the given ctype.
Since:
2008.b

getAlignment

public int getAlignment(CType ctype)
Calculates the alignment of the given CType object.

If the given ctype is a Struct or Array then it must be fully initialized to evaluate the member resp. elements correctly. If a Struct implementing the IConditionalMembers interface is given then this method considers only those members that exist according to the result of method IConditionalMembers.exists(String).

Parameters:
ctype - A CType object.
Returns:
The aligment requirements of the given ctype.
Since:
2008.b

getAlignment

protected int getAlignment(Struct struct)
Calculates the alignment requirements of the given struct. - Structs must be at least aligned as strict as their strictes member => alignment requirement is maximum of alignment requirement of the strictes element and the one passed in the type descriptor

Parameters:
struct - A fully initialized struct object.
Returns:
The alignment requirements in bytes.
